On Fri, 6 Oct 2023 13:45:11 -0400, Justin emailed Agwhaley regarding "Loss of wages letter":

Case: Michael-Crader-MVA-5-19-2023
Client: Michael Crader
__FW: Loss of wages letter__
Justin Chumbley
Whaley Law Firm
With the accident that occurred on May 19,2023 it caused loss of wages as well as additional loss that is hard to measure. We had to hire out the input of waterline because with Mike?s injury to his back he was unable to put the waterline in himself. The cost of the waterline was $10,800. Mikes was hoping that his back injury would be healed so we could put the fence in but as of today, October 6, 2023 he is still hurting. With the fence unable to be constructed we had to purchase additional hay to feed our cattle. The field that was unable to be fenced produces approximately 500 rolls worth of feed for cattle. With the drought we only could secure 463 bales of hay at $55 a bale totaling $25,465 to offset the cattle unable to graze on the unfenced field due to the injury caused by the accident on May 19,2023. This does not take into account all the additional projects and maintenance that need to be done on the farm that we are unable to do due to Mike?s injury. We are self-employed farmers on top of the loss of wages, the amount of stress and mental anguish this has caused is staggering.
Sincerely
Mary Jane & Michael Crader
Sent from my iPad

The VA has received your request for billing records regarding M. Crader
relating to treatment provided by or paid for by the Lexington VA
Healthcare System. Please note the request can take up to 60 days to
process.

vhalexcpacmscpacfacilityrevenuelexington@va.gov

Healthcare System: https://www.va.gov/lexington-health-care/
Information on how to submit a new VA billing request, requesting bills for
family members of veterans and other helpful information can be found here:
https://www.va.gov/OGC/Collections.asp
Please be advised that failure to respond with information necessary for VA
to identify its claim does not absolve you of your duty to VA. Be advised
that all Veterans and Veterans' beneficiaries, or those individuals acting
on their behalf, have an affirmative duty to notify VA of care provided or
paid for in connection with a personal injury or workers compensation case.
88 Fed. Reg. 8344. As such, prior to distributing any proceeds from a
settlement or judgment, it is your responsibility to confer with the
Veteran to ensure that the Veteran has not received related care provided
or paid for by VA (including pending or potential claims for VA payment).
======================================================================================================================

Aaron

We had a guy working for us part-time and I had to call him in and to work the day of the accident. $300 was paid by kfb
We lost wages by having to hire out to have waterline put in $10,800. Not reimbursed.
My wife hasn’t been able to go out and work because now she has to do a lot of the work that I was supposed to be able to do on the farm so that is lost wages.

Taxes for the last 5 years ? Why do they need our taxes. That doesn’t make sense and don’t want them to know what money I have. I don’t want them to come after us, knowing them amount of money we have.

Replied to Client:
Good morning Michael,
While yes the things you listed are 'Special Damages', they do not necessarily fall under the 'Lost Wage' category. This particular question is directly related to your lost income, not additionally incurred expenses. As far as your Taxes, your Taxes are directly related to your income. As a self-employed individual/business owner, your Taxes are your statement of income to the government and are used to determine and verify your claim of 'Lost Wages', any diminished capacity to earn as well as any lost revenue from your farm. However, I will note your questions to Aaron & Bryce for further explanation if needed. 
__Person Making Contact:__ Sarena
__Date & Time__: December 23 2024

Case: Michael-Crader-MVA-5-19-2023
Client: Michael Crader

FILE REORGANIZATION COMPLETE - Michael Crader MVA Case: Completed comprehensive 5-phase file reorganization using 8-bucket directory system. Phase 1: Generated inventory of 94 files with 53 scrambled .md files for content-only analysis (filenames randomized to eliminate bias). Phase 2: Parallel processing with 3 sub-agents analyzing 40-file chunks to prevent context exhaustion. Phase 3: Quality review achieved 98.44% accuracy (1.56% error rate - only 1 error: VitalChart invoice miscategorized as Medical Records instead of Expenses, corrected before execution). Phase 4: Successfully executed 68 operations (67 moves/renames, 1 deletion) with zero execution errors. Phase 5: Verified 100% naming convention compliance, all PDF+MD companions reunited, root directory cleaned. RESULTS: 150 files organized across 8 buckets - Medical Records (60 files across 16 providers with Medical Records/Bills/Requests subfolders: Air Methods Corporation, Morgan County Ambulance, UK Healthcare, University of Kentucky, Morehead Physical Therapy, etc.), Insurance (27 files: BI/Kentucky Farm Bureau, PIP/Erie Insurance, PIP/Everett Cash Mutual, PIP/Capstone, UIM folder), Litigation (28 files including complaint, answer, discovery requests/responses, 2 files flagged NEEDS REVIEW for illegible Certificate of Service dates), Client (7 files: voicemails, communications), Investigation (9 files: scene photos), Expenses (2 files: VitalChart records retrieval invoice $139 waived), Case Information (16 JSON system files). KEY CASE DETAILS CONFIRMED: Accident 5/19/2023 Morgan County KY, defendant Megan Combs, lawsuit filed 5/21/2024 Morgan Circuit 24-CI-00065, defense counsel John Ellis (Dehner & Ellis), discovery completed 8/29/2024, policy limits $25K KFB BI (claim #4863358), medical bills exceed $100K (Air Methods $82,859, UK Hospital $37,316, West Liberty PT $2,905, Morgan County EMS $1,331), VA lien $86,505.91 creates critical shortfall issue, client is veteran farmer. All files now follow standard naming convention YYYY-MM-DD - Michael Crader - {Category} - {Originator} - {Description}. Case ready for continued litigation and settlement negotiations. Complete reorganization documentation saved to Reports/ directory including quality review summary, reorganization map, and verification report.
